meanings.definition: A type of complex carbohydrate found in connective tissues.
meanings.sent1: The glycosaminoglycans provide structure and support to our joints.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study glycosaminoglycans to understand their role in the body.
meanings.sent3: Why did the carbohydrate break up with the glycosaminoglycans? They needed some space!
meanings.sent4: The glycosaminoglycans are like the building blocks of our connective tissues.
meanings.sent5: In the body, glycosaminoglycans act like the glue holding things together.

meanings.definition: Polysaccharides composed of repeating disaccharide units.
meanings.sent1: Researchers are investigating the structure of glycosaminoglycans at a molecular level.
meanings.sent2: Food sources rich in glycosaminoglycans can benefit joint health.
meanings.sent3: The disaccharide units in glycosaminoglycans seem to have a sweet relationship.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flowed like the repeating disaccharide units in glycosaminoglycans.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the repeating patterns of glycosaminoglycans are mesmerizing.
